title: 113_s1268
content: SECTION 1. APPROVAL OF THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE REPUBLIC OF PALAU. Definitions: Agreement refers to the document signed by both countries on September 3, 2010. Compact of Free Association is the agreement between the US and Palau. Amendment to Public Law 99-658 includes results of Compact Review. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010 are approved, with exceptions and subject to certain provisions. If Palau withdraws over $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal year 2011, funds may be withheld. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau approves the withdrawal of funds from the trust fund, with exceptions. If Palau withdraws more than $5,000,000 in fiscal years 2011, 2012, or 2013, funds payable under certain sections will be withheld until the excess amount is reimbursed. Additionally, the Secretary of the Treasury is required to transfer necessary funds to the Secretary of the Interior for implementation of specific sections of the Agreement. Authorization of appropriations is also provided. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to subsidize postal services to certain countries with $1,500,000 annually until 2024. Federal entities under the Compact of Free Association are also authorized necessary funds for their responsibilities. These appropriations remain available until expended. The Compact of Free Association authorizes necessary funds for federal entities under section 221(a) and repeals section 3 of the Act of June 30, 1954. Payment schedules and fund withholding are outlined in Compact section 211(f). Compact section 211(f) outlines payment schedules and fund withholding for federal entities under the Compact of Free Association. The Government of the United States will contribute $30,250,000 to the Fund in accordance with a specified schedule. Additionally, a grant of $6,912,000 for fiscal year 2014 and $2,000,000 annually from 2015 to 2024 will be provided for the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund. The Government of Palau will match contributions made by the United States to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund from fiscal year 2014 through 2024. The fiscal consolidation fund will be implemented according to the provisions of the Agreement. The fiscal consolidation fund will be implemented in accordance with the Agreement. The Government of the United States will provide Palau with $10,000,000 in fiscal year 2014 to reduce government arrears. Additionally, Palau will receive $69,250,000 in economic assistance, with $12,000,000 allocated for fiscal year 2014. The Government of the United States will provide Palau with $69,250,000 in economic assistance over ten fiscal years, starting with $12,000,000 in fiscal year 2014 and decreasing annually until $2,000,000 in fiscal year 2023. The funds will be distributed quarterly unless specified otherwise. The Government of the United States will provide Palau with $69,250,000 in economic assistance over ten fiscal years, starting with $12,000,000 in fiscal year 2014 and decreasing annually until $2,000,000 in fiscal year 2023. The funds will be distributed quarterly unless specified otherwise, with infrastructure projects falling under a specific section of the Agreement. The Government of the United States will provide grants totaling $40,000,000 to Palau for infrastructure projects over three fiscal years. Additionally, there is an amendment to extend a program until 2024 and a clarification on passport requirements. Nonimmigrants in the US and its territories can be admitted without certain passport restrictions if they are citizens of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands or acquire Palauan citizenship. Persons who acquire Palauan citizenship at birth or through naturalization and have been residents for at least five years can work in the US with permission from the Secretary of Homeland Security. They may establish habitual residence in a US territory or possession, subject to non-discriminatory limitations in US statutes or regulations. Section 141(a) does not grant a Palauan citizen the right to establish residence for naturalization under US law or petition for benefits for alien relatives. However, it does not prevent a Palauan citizen from acquiring rights or lawful permanent resident status in the US.
